channel.title: DJ Mr Jay's Podcast
channel.description:
Dj Mr Jay hosts "The Truth"The latest and best R&B, Soul, Funk and Disco show live on the Internet.
If you want to get a feel for the development or urban black music in the UK, and the effect it’s had on club culture, a quick glance at Mr Jay’s resume gives you a potted history of it all!
His roots go back to 1978, being part of Soul Incorporated Roadshow, which went on to play all over the UK alongside the best reggae and soul sounds, such as Sir Coxsone, Saxon International and Java Hi-Power.
By 1981, Jay had moved into early hip-hop, hosting the best jams in London’s Swiss Cottage working with Mindgame and the group Syn-Di-Cut.
Since 1986 Jay has spent his time between playing at underground jams and more commercial affairs, often hosting corporate parties for film launches and the like.
Mark Devlin – Blues and Soul Magazine

channel.itunes:author: Jay

item.title: Muhammad Ayers - F.R.E.D
item.description: F.R.E.D. – This Is The Night Michael Ayers is a singer/songwriter/producer from St. Mary Parish Louisiana & a recent signee of Atlantic Records who has crafted a sound that he affectionately calls “Free & Open”. His latest EP/Mixtape features 16 tracks of pure Soul and R&B including “Mine Tonight” which features Robin Thicke. Many have described him as a true homage to great soul singers from the past as well as a sure sign of the future. One listen to him weather LIVE or on wax leaves no mistaking who and what his influences are! F.R.E.D. is available to download at http://www.wix.com/keakevene/muhammad-ayers Enjoy Dj Mr Jay “The Truth” (Soul Groove Radio)

item.title: Micheal Ayers "Mine Tonight"
item.description: Michael Ayers is a singer/songwriter/producer from St. Mary Parish Louisiana & a recent signee of Atlantic Records who has crafted a sound that he affectionately calls “Free & Open”. “I get tired of hearing songs that are so full of production and sounds for the sake of having sounds on the track that you barely even hear the singer that the song is supposed to be for. Back in the day, every instrument was just another way to tell the story. Another part that added to the whole. Music is the framework, the artist is the canvas.” Born to a singing father from Ohio and a songwriting mother from Louisiana, the second youngest of eight children all singer/musicians in their own right, Mr. Ayers was literally born into music. “My mother told me that I literally rode into this world to The Isley Brothers. That’s not what most kids would want to hear from their parents, but I loved it. It let me know that this was my destiny from the get go. ”Mr Ayers has been singing since the age of two and performing professionally since the age of 13. He has been a writer and producer of his own music since the age of 15. Many have described him as a true homage to great soul singers from the past as well as a sure sign of the future. One listen to him weather LIVE or on wax leaves no mistaking who and what his influences are. “Music is like time, there are no straight lines, only circles. Everything comes back around again. The 60’s, 70’s and 80’s have all had a resurgence. It’s only a matter of time before the 90’s get their turn in the limelight once again.” That means good singing laid back production and style marrying substance, not replacing it. And if Mr Ayers has his way, then he plans on being one of music’s leading archaeologists. For more info: (404)-625-4310 Keakevene@yahoo.com

item.title: The Truth - Podcast 107
item.description: Dear Music Lovers, We would like to wish all our listeners worldwide a “Happy New Year 2012”. This final podcast simply comprises of 8 authentic soul/classic funk and extremely rare tracks that you will only hear from us on “The Truth” via Soul Groove Radio, Podomatic and iTunes Podcasting. Our featured artists include, Roy Ayres, Locksmith, Earth Wind & Fire, Lonnie Liston Smith, Charles Earland, Brass Construction, George Clinton and The Players Association. I would also like to thank my music mentor LIA for bringing the best in new Soul/Neo-Soul and R&B to the table, plus all the people who make a positive contribute to putting together one of the world’s top underground podcasts on the Internet. For track listings, requests, dedications and bookings for Dj Mr Jay in 2012 contact us at info@djmrjaylive.com, BBMPIN:272AB803

The show includes tracks by Steve Shelto, The B.B & Q Band, Vaughan Mason & Crew, David Beniot, Chuck Brown & The Soul Searchers, Yellow Magic Orchestra, The Limit, Heaven and Earth, Maze, feat Frankie Beverley, Leon Ware and Breakwater.

item.title: The Truth - Interview with Dj Fingers
item.description:
With 28 years experience Dj Fingers is without doubt one of the finest breakbeat Dj’s in the world. For this exclusive interview he takes time out to speak to Dj Mr Jay (SSRadio) on “The Truth” about the definition of Hip-Hop.
DJ Fingers is one of the UK’s original Breakbeat DJ for MC's, and understood the link to Afrika Bambaataa's Bronx River Sound system Tradition. As one of the first turntablists in the UK, DJ Fingers was influenced by DJ’s like Grandmaster Flash, Herc, Grandmixer DST, DJ Whizz Kid (Rip)and DJ Jazzy Jay. Foreword from forth coming Book: “The Misappropriation of Hip-Hip” There’s very good reason why you should take time to engage with Dj Finger’s thoughts on hip-hop.
As a child of the pre-Technics days of pause button cassette mixes, he can rightly claim to being one of the earliest deejays in Britain to devote himself (under the name of DJ Fingers) to the spirit of hip-hop, and the fact that he’s done so in the service of the emcees he’s worked with - rather than in that of his own ego - is testament to his heartfelt belief in hip-hop as a community pursuit.
For more info, contact Dj Fingers on http://www.myspace.com/djfingersofthesindecut

item.title: The Truth - Swiss Cottage (Live) 1986
item.description:
Friday 26th September 1986, Dj Mr Jay presented 100% Hip-Hop and Go-Go to the UK. The live session was recorded at the Swiss Cottage Community Centre (London) to a live audience and featured the best in UK Hip-Hop. The line up; Dj Fingers (The Syn-Di-Cut), Cash C (Soul Inc), Mc Crazy Noddy (The Syn-Di-Cut), Turbo C (Soul Inc) and the legendary MC Seargent Rock.
The simple concept of two turntables, one microphone, an MC and a fusion of different beats is a true definition of real Hip-Hop. After 23 years this still remains a true masterclass of UK Hip-Hop.
Enjoy!
Dj Mr Jay (Soul Inc)

item.title: Trouble Funk Exclusive
item.description: If you like your Washington Go-Go, check out the exclusive track available to the listeners of the Mr Jay's Podcast. Miles off the radar of popular music during the early '80s, Trouble Funk energized their D.C. home with the sound of go-go music, an uproarious blend of swinging, up-tempo '70s funk and a '60s-style horn section. The band formed in 1978, and the line-up coalesced around drummer Emmet Nixon, percussionists Mack Carey and Timothius Davis, guitarist Chester Davis, bassist Tony Fisher, trombone players Gerald and Robert Reed, trumpeter Taylor Reed, keyboard player James Avery, and saxophonist David Rudd.

item.title: DC Uncovered
item.description: As politicians make the rules, and the budget is debated under a lighted dome in the Capitol Building, a hidden world lives in anticipation to a deliberate groove that our Nation's Capital breathes under. Facing drama each and every day, we have gone where no cameras have ever been before, inside the dark pits of the explosive controversial underground world of DC's own Go-Go Live Experience

item.title: Richard Emberstone (Amazing Love) Exclusive
item.description: Richard Emberstone the new RnB soul sensation dropped by to have a chat with Dj Mr Jay about his new release the "Amazing Love" EP. Due to be released on independent label zum music in early April. Richard spoke about his influences in music as well as the thoughts behind his new material. Citing such heavyweights as Stevie Wonder and Aretha Franklin as inspirations, Richard who writes and produces all of his songs offers a smooth yet funky throwback to the old school soul and RnB heydays. In 2009 we will see this young talent rise amongst his industry peers and offer some real competition. His songs range from make up's to break up's and life experiences in between, whilst the musical arrangements flow from contemporary to classic Richard Emberstone manages to ensure all tastes are catered for. Whether you are grabbed by the funky yet pop title track "Amazing love" or seduced by the lead single "If you were a secret" his warm silky vocal tones will do enough to pull you in. He is one for now and he is also one to watch for the future remember the name Emberstone-Amazing love 2009 www.myspace.com/zummusic

item.title: Episode 40 - The Truth feat Civilian
item.description: Missed last week's show? Hear the best selection of music from Dj Mr Jay and Sherri G, Also our live interview with Mose from the band Civilian. When Adam Moseley remarked to his friends how amazing it would be to create one of the best bands in Britain, there was only one problem, none of them could play an instrument. Undeterred, the gauntlet was taken up, and with little equipment and no immediate spark, the group locked themselves away and began to work hard. Surprised by the sound that they eventually developed, and the incredible reaction to it, the Horsham-based group decided Civilian was a suitable name for the band, showing that though it is easy to keep your head down and be content to blend in with the crowd,when you actually make the effort to search inside you can find abilities that make you shine.

item.title: Episode 39 - The Truth feat Lloyd
item.description:
Lloyd who was born James Robert Lloyd (born May 13, 1979) is an English singer, songwriter, producer and musician. He is the son of a former newspaper editor Nicholas Lloyd and his step-sister is well-known UK TV presenter Claudia Winkleman.

His debut ‘Pain of Life’ EP is a very special record, urgent and profound; it makes a striking impression on all who hear it. From the driving pulse of blues drenched masterpiece ‘Red Blood Sky’, with it’s pulsating rock guitar and gritty vocal punch, to the full throttle hum of sublime classic ‘Sundown’, you know you’re in for a spine tingling ride.

item.title: Episode 38 - The Truth feat Dele
item.description:
Delé, singer/performer/songwriter, is a young man from East London who has already made a name for himself in various parts of the country for his singing style and stage performances. It was at the ripe young age of eight when Delé wrote his first song and also discovered that he had the ability to hold a musical note. That is when it all started for him and he embarked on his musical career. Being new to the world of music he started off as a member in a band then decided to go it alone and consequently went solo. He has remained a solo artist ever since specialising in a number of musical styles such as R&B, Soul and Pop.


The first single, ‘She Makes Me Hot’ put him in the spotlight and further enhanced his already burgeoning reputation to a wider audience and it was from that initial exposure, Delé was approached to do other projects in 2004. The second single ‘Ex’ has taken Delé to a whole new level and has courted a number of rave reviews from radio stations all over the UK with him being likened to a number of already established artists.

item.title: Episode 36 - The Truth ft Mamacoca
item.description: Missed the last show? hear the best Soul and R&B from Dj Mr Jay and Sherri G from www.lifefm.org.uk (London). The show includes an exclusive interview with Mamacoca: It has only been a few months since the completion of their debut album ‘Secrets’, and already has Mamacoca signed a distribution deal that would see their album hit the shops shortly; this is on the back of countless radio plays, radio and TV interviews and live appearances nationally and abroad. Not satisfied with their current repertoire, Mamacoca has greedily taken to the studios again and have continued their crusade-like writing campaign, completing tunes to be showcased on the stages of a number of 2008 summer festivals. Mamacoca blends emotions drawn from Herbie Hancock to Led Zeppelin, back to Stevie Wonder, producing a funky union of Soul and Jazz, and has been akin somewhat to the funkiness of Jamiroquai on a liberal diet of Quincy Jones.

item.title: The Truth feat Harry Mindgame
item.description:
Missed the last show? Dj Mr Jay and Sherri G from www.lifefm.org.uk play the best in soul and R&B, with our special guest "Harry Mindgame".
Mindgame - Been in and around Hip-Hop, R&B, and Soul for a number of years. Been there in the early days when UK Hip-Hop was developing and evolving. Started out DJ’ing with Soul Incorporated Roadshow where he was schooled in Soul, R&B, Jazz and early Hip-Hop.
During these days MindGame met up with Dave Cash C, DJ Fingers, who, at the time was deeply involved in the burgeoning UK Hip-Hop scene. As with most things, this led to the younger guy’s in Soul Incorporated (Mr Jay, MindGame, Big Steve) slipping off and developing their own Hip-Hop promotions.
Pure Indulgence Promotions
Was set up in 2007 by Vivienne "Empress' Morgan and Harry Mindgame as a vehicle for club and event promotions. Pure Indulgence is aimed at the sophisticated “raver” who enjoys a comfortable, relaxed and friendly night out.
Two successful events have been held so far with the next on 12th July 2008 in association with Mr C from the Nasty Boyz.

Pure Indulgence Promotions
Was set up in 2007 by Vivienne "Empress' Morgan and Harry Mindgame as a vehicle for club and event promotions. Pure Indulgence is aimed at the sophisticated “raver” who enjoys a comfortable, relaxed and friendly night out.
Two successful events have been held so far with the next on 12th July 2008 in association with Mr C from the Nasty Boyz.

item.title: The Truth feat Anatasha
item.description: Anatasha is a singer, musician and prolific songwriter from Royal Leamington Spa, in the heart of England. She has grown up surrounded by musicians and singers, listening to music of many genres, from many decades. This has provided a wide influence and a great passion of music has developed since an early age. Anatasha loves performing live on stage and has produced heart stopping a cappella performances to room-filled, star-struck audiences. She has performed on the same billing as Dexy’s Midnight Runners’ Kevin Rowland. Influences are Norah Jones, Frou Frou, Tegan & Sara and KT Tunstall. Her other favourite artists include Wallis Bird, M.I.A., Mr Hudson & The Library, Red Hot Chili Peppers, Tiesto and Pendulum. The sweet, dulcet tones of her voice really do move the listener, together with the beautiful lyrics and melody she writes for her songs. A guitarist and classically trained pianist, she is also studying Law at De Montfort University in Leicester. Anatasha is very excited about the collaboration with producer and multi-instrumentalist Paul Hogg (aka ‘Ox’). Paul has written and recorded 5 tracks for which, Anatasha has written the lyrics and melody. The combination is simply exquisite, bringing Paul’s smooth sounds and originality to Anatasha’s soul searching lyrics with her beguiling voice. The first of the 5 tracks is to be released as the single ‘Take Your Time’ in August 2008 and will be followed by a 5-Track EP later in the year. Anatasha: http://www.myspace.com/anatashamusic

item.title: The Truth feat Blue Jar
item.description: “Blue Jar combines the panache of Grappelli with Gypsy flamboyance, yet balances this passion with a dreamy, atmospheric classical sound”. With ‘Ducks and Geese’ to their credit, their second album “Pelican Crossing” is currently on general release. Since their first gig 2005-a Garden Party for H.R.H The Prince of Wales they have specialised in corporate work - They are now ‘doing’ the live gig and festival circuit, following the success of their album, and recent festival performances at the Cork Jazz Festival, Greenbelt and the Cathedral Quarter Arts Festival. They played at the Marbella Film Festival and attended WOMEX, Spain in Oct and also showcased at MEI, Italy in Nov. They have recently signed a 3 year management deal with W.O.A International for India, the Middle East and Asia, and have a licensing deal in the same territories. They will be on tour in India Jan 08 for 5 weeks with support from MTV. They are also due to perform in Portugal, Cyprus, Austria, Germany and Brazil in 2008.

item.title: The Truth featuring B-Force
item.description: Check out the live exclusive video with B-Force (Video on Channel U and MTV) B-Force is part of LMP Crew bringing you the best of reggae dancehall. B-Force grew up in the Gambia from a very young age and knew from the start he wanted to become a song writer, playing the drums from the age of eight and with music constantly around him, B-Force then soon started to write his own tunes. Growing up B-Force was surrounded by nothing but reggae and became involved in a local dance group which took him all over Gambia. B-Force decided he wanted to explore England and came over when he was just sixteen and continued writing, returning to Gambia in 2001 which saw the release of his very first single "Send your money" which rocketed to No 1 and stayed in the charts for a whopping five weeks. Growing up B-Force's soul influences were Sean Paul, Shabba Ranks and the legendary Bob Marley. B-Force now hopes to bring his musical talents to the UK and for his crew to show you what they are made of. B-Force The Flow Is Liquid. Check out the interview with Dj Mr Jay and Sherri G from Life FM!

item.title: The Truth feat Spoonface
item.description: Living On The Venus Express is the first and eagerly anticipated solo album offering from Spoonface, an album which highlights his true vocal capabilities. With a sophisticated blend of acoustic folk/pop and a hint of reggae influence, this album’s appeal aims at a wide and diverse spectrum of listener. Spoonface had his first taste of international recording success as Black Legend with his reworking of the Barry White classic “You See The Trouble With Me” reaching No. 1 in the UK and selling over 2 million copies. His distinctive vocals make him instantly recognizable and provide the uniqueness that commands a strong following from his loyal fan base, as well as the appreciation and respect from fellow musicians. He has collaborated with numerous renowned artists from varying genres, and presently enjoys success in the UK and Europe with a number of dance projects including Floor Boogie act Ear Dis. Living On The Venus Express glorifies the true depth of his ability.

item.title: The Truth ft Julie Mckee
item.description: A classically trained pianist, Julie studied English and Spanish at Cardiff University before being accepted onto the Guildhall School of Music & Drama's master’s course in jazz. Yet her musical influences range far and wide, taking in pop, soul, rock, blues and classical, and she brings all these to the table in her forthcoming release. "I listen to all kinds of music and would hate my songs to be described simply as one genre. To me, good music is good music, wherever it comes from," she says.

item.title: The Truth - Classic Funk
item.description: Dj Mr Jay and Sherri G from www.lifefm.org.uk hosts one hour of classic Jazz Funk, P-Funk with a live interview with Lazy Poker. Lazy Poker came together in this current line-up in 2003, in time to play the Dundee Blues Bonanza, Europe's largest free blues music festival. Our first album, The Real Deal, was released and we were excited to find radio airplay happening in USA and Australia. A deal for Blues Matters to distribute this album led to an agreement to record 3 albums for their label. Our first Blues Matters album was released in August 2007 and has been a top 10 blues album download success on iTunes. Recorded: 20/02/2008

item.title: The Truth ft Kobe
item.description: Missed last week show? hear the live interview with Kobe, plus the best Soul and R&B tracks for January 2008! Kobe was born Vincent Kobina Enos on 11th December 1984. Named after his father Vincent Enos Snr. From an early age his name was abbreviated to Kobe. His middle names literally means "born on Tuesday", hence his first album being dubbed "Tuesday’s child". His mother Abigail Louisa Parkes, decided she would teach him her language (goa) before she taught him English, so as to keep in touch with his roots. This made difficult communication in his early days, but before he left nursery, this was no longer a problem. His first true experience of music came from his mother who was an avid church goer and also an active member of the choir. Kobe became quite attached to the idea of music, but started of with an instrument before he discovered his voice. It wasn't until midway through primary school that Kobe was told he had a voice. Show recorded: 23/01/08 at www.lifefm.org.uk

item.title: Live Interview with KC Genesis Jones
item.description:
Our special guest this week is KC “Genesis Jones” from Sounds II Records, Harlesden. With many years of experience in the music industry, KC is also a professional Dj who has worked at the highest level.
Our local specialist music stores provides a unique service online stores cannot offer; the personal touch and advice from knowledgeable staff keeps independent music alive.
With more people downloading songs through online stores, our local independent records shops are in decline.
Are we supporting our local music stores?

item.title: The Truth - Live Interview with T'rese
item.description: Live interview with T’rese Take a little of Sade, Tracy Chapman, Des'ree mixed with a little Roberta Flack then you have T'rese, already acclaimed for her talent in the likeness of these top chart-selling legendary artists. T'rese's music unveils a wealth of talent... the labour of a genuinely multi-talented Singer/Songwriter. She's a lady who knows precisely what she desires. And when necessary, she resorts to her overwhelmingly mesmerising charm to dictate the sort of response she expects. In view of her positive outlook on life and the way she so apply utilizes her tremendous gratifying propensities, she's ever so willing to make the sacrifices to attain her ultimate goal.

item.title: Live interview with Dj Stretch Taylor (Blues & Soul Magazine)
item.description:
"When anyone talks about D.J. Stretch Taylor, the one superlative thing mentioned by the promoters & punters is Stretch rocks the clubs! He is the peoples DJ".
Stretch mixed the official mix C.D. for superstar Missy Elliott for her multi-platinum album 'Miss E So Addictive' .
Support DJ at live concerts/PA's featuring: Fabolous, Mario Winans, Kindred The Family Soul, Metropolis, Fatman Scoop, Mica Paris, Terri Walker, Ty, Tashas World, Roll Deep, Omar, Iceberg Slimm, Hinda Hicks & Sista Factory (Sandra St. Victor, Kellie Sae, Laurnea, Karen Bernod.
Over the years he's played at clubs throughout the UK & Europe including: Ministry Of Sound, Twice As Nice, Global Room at Erick Morillo's Subliminal Sessions @ Pacha Ibiza, Privilege Ibiza (Guinness Book Of Records Biggest Club), Smoove, Jazz Cafe, 10Rooms, Cookies & Cream, Fresh Cream/Exposure, Kabaret Prophecy, Mash, Embassy, Café De Paris, Kiss100 Smooth Grooves @ Trap, NYT, Click, Rainforest Café, Cargo, Greece, Cyprus, Czechoslovakia, Ireland, Scotland, Wales, annual events including Notting Hill Carnival, TMF Music Festival, SoulVille Weekender, Soul Village Weekender & award-winning club nights like Get Down @ Bar Rumba, Club8090 @ Corks & Rubber Soul @ Junction, Cambridge. He also hosts club nights for Blues &Soul Magazine and has been co-promoting his own successful soul music event 'The Boating Club' for a decade

item.title: Live Interview with Jon Scott
item.description:
Jon has been writing, performing and indulging in music since childhood and has appeared in various Stage Productions, including versions of Andrew Lloyd Webber's musical "Jesus Christ Superstar", the acclaimed South African Musical "Ipi Tombi".
Jon performs either with his band and can also play acoustic sets. He has performed with bands, both in England, Africa and the United States and has played and performed at various live events and festivals.
The album and promo CD has been put together with Jon working with the highly talented Gordon Hulbert as his Co-Producer. Gordon's credits include such diverse Artists as Chaka Khan, Russell Watson, Alison Limerick, Hugh Masakela, Salif Keita, Angie Brown, Imagination, Suzie Quatro, Heatwave, to name but a few.
Date: Wednesday 3rd October 2007

item.title: The Truth ft Tippa Irie
item.description: Catch the interview live on Life Fm, with Dj Mr Jay Tippa Irie" - emerged from England's Saxon Sound International - the star-studded travelling sound system that has been at the forefront of the U.K. reggae dancehall scene for the past 25 years and helped launch the careers of artists such as Maxi Priest, Papa Levi and Smiley Culture. Tippa Irie has produced fifteen albums to date and has a string of number 1 hit songs to his credit including "Hey Mama" with the Black Eyed Peas, "Hello Darling", "Raggamuffin Girl" (featuring Peter Hunnigale), "Stress" (featuring Lloyd Brown), "Superwoman" (featuring Winsome), "Baby I've Been Missing You" (featuring Janet Lee Davis), "Sensi" feat the Long Beach Dub AllStars and "Shouting for the Gunners"--a song originally recorded for the Arsenal Football Team which reached the Top 30 status on the British pop charts.

item.title: Washington D.C. Go-Go Preview
item.description:
Live interview with James Blake - Go-Go music producer and film director from Washington DC.
On Wednesday 4th July we featured a special show focuced on Washington D.C. Go-Go, with an exclusive live interview with James Blake live in the USA.
Go-Go is a unique sound, with many rap and R&B artists having sampled beats from existing Go-Go records, to create some of the finest hits that you have heard in Rap and R&B music over the past two decades (most often without crediting the Go-Go scene in Washington D.C.).

Live interview with James Blake - Go-Go music producer and film director from Washington DC.
On Wednesday 4th July we featured a special show focuced on Washington D.C. Go-Go, with an exclusive live interview with James Blake live in the USA.
Go-Go is a unique sound, with many rap and R&B artists having sampled beats from existing Go-Go records, to create some of the finest hits that you have heard in Rap and R&B music over the past two decades (most often without crediting the Go-Go scene in Washington D.C.).

item.title: Interview With Michael Sprott
item.description: Michael defended his title against 2000 Olympic Gold medalist Audley Harrison in London, February 2007. Harrison had demolished Danny Williams in his last fight and was on course to face Matt Skelton in a world title eliminator. A 9/2 underdog with most bookies, Sprott came off the floor in the 1st round to knock Harrison clean out in the 3rd with a left hook.

item.title: Interview with Wayne Lawes
item.description: SYKLONE PRODUCTIONS consists of Wayne Lawes & Rickardo Reid, formerly of Kreuz, and the urban collective, Full Crew Productions. Wayne, a bass player par excellence with in excess of 15 years engineering experience and Rickardo a classically trained pianist and midi technician, have developed from being both live and session musicians, to a dynamic writing and production duo. Their musicianship has constantly stood them in good stead when working for the likes of Mariah Carey, George Michael, and Mary J Blige. Their writing and production skills resulted in what became the uniquely identifiable first single “Fill Me In”, by Craig David in the US.
